## Model Structure

Our experts can support you running the optimal models based on your situation:

| Situation                         | Best Fit           |
|-----------------------------------|--------------------|
| Acute, short-term                 | Decision tree      |
| Chronic disease, simple structure | Markov cohort      |
| Survival-driven oncology          | Semi-Markov or PSM |
| Strong time-in-state effects      | Semi-Markov        |
| High heterogeneity                | Microsimulation    |
| Operational/system constraints    | DES                |

## Our reference

1.  Was the question clearly stated and answerable?

2.  Was a comprehensive overview of the competing alternatives presented ?

3.  Was evidence provided to demonstrate the effectiveness of the program or service?

4.  Were the key costs and consequences of each alternative comprehensively identified

5.  Were the costs and consequences quantified precisely in appropriate physical units prior to their valuation?

6.  Was the valuation of costs and consequences conducted in a credible manner ?

7.  Were adjustments made to the costs and consequences to reflect differences in timing?

8.  Was an incremental analysis performed to evaluate the differential costs and consequences between the alternatives?

9.  Was the uncertainty associated with the estimates of costs and consequences clearly identified and appropriately described?

10. Were all user-relevant concerns adequately addressed in the presentation and discussion of the studyâ€™s findings?
